chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Esteban Moreno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "C" Felony], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.

superMiscConds.notes:
Attend parenting class.
Participate in an English as a second language program.
Maintain employment of at least 20 hours per week.

No contact with the victim, Court will allow contact with Jacqueline M.  If she agrees to have contact and it is approved by the agent.
No contact with any child under the age of 18 years.
May not maintain any social media accounts.  Court will allow defendant to have an email account. Defendant to turn  over any electronic devices to agent for inspection upon demand.

Restitution set at zero.
Register and comply with the sex offender registry.
Obtain/comply wit sex offender treatment.
Report make, model and license plate of vehicle to agent.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample,unless prevouisly submitted, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession, voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Esteban Moreno

Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-18-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant sworn as to his statements.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Any statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 48 hours in advance of sentencing.  
Court orders a presentence investigation.  Order received and filed.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 25.  Jury trial is vacated.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Case recalled.
State files Amended Information with the court:

Count 1:  Second Degree Sexual Assault Of A Child (<16 Years Of Age), a Class C Felony, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 948.02(2), 939.50(3)(c).

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Esteban Moreno in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Defendant Esteban Moreno in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Sworn as Interpreter: Dawn Maldonado. Parties inform the court they have not reached a resolution in this matter and are prepared to proceed to trial. State will leave offer open until the day of trial. Court advised the parties it may attempt to locate a spin due to a jury trial starting earlier that week. Discussion regarding video-recorded statement of the victim. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 7/30/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
State's Notice of Intent to Introduce Child's Video-Recorded Statement with DVD attachment received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Esteban Moreno in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Defendant Esteban Moreno in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Sworn as Interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. Court reviewed motions in limine filed by both parties and made rulings as to the motions. Discussion regarding prior convictions of the defendant and any other witnesses. Arguments heard as to other acts motion filed by the State. Subject to the other acts witnesses appearance in court during the trial, Court will allow the other acts evidence to be introduced at trial. State placed offer on the record. Defense counsel requested an additional final pretrial date closer to the jury trial. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 7/30/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Esteban Moreno in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Defendant Esteban Moreno in custody.  Paul Tiffin for Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Brenda Bartholomew.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Shannon Orvis-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.

Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JM (6/10/2002); Jacqueline M; Danielle M., SMM (4-7-1994).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant please Not Guilty to COUNT 1. DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
